data.title: Southwest Airlines
data.meta_description: SOUTHWEST AIRLINES Collective Bargaining Agreement Customer Representative, Customer Service Agent, Customer Contract Service Lead, SOS Representative Dec 15, 2022 – Dec 14, 2027 Related Documents Letter of Understanding Number Thirteen (LOU 13) Me-Too Bulletin – April 9, 2024 New Updates for all Classifications IAM Negotiated Pay RatesNew Top of Scale rates after implementation of Me […]
data.text:
Your negotiating committee met August 6-9, 2018 in Kansas City, Missouri at the office of District Lodge 142. Present were; Ian Scott-Anderman, DL142 Secretary Treasurer;

On July 24-26, 2018 your negotiating committee met in Kansas City, Missouri to continue contract negotiations. Present for the company: Adam Carlisle, Sr. Director, Labor

On July 10-12, 2018 your negotiating committee met in Dallas at Southwest Airlines Headquarters to continue contract negotiations. Present for the company: Adam Carlisle, Sr.

On June 26-28, 2018, your negotiating committee met in Tempe, Arizona to continue contract negotiations. Present for the company: Adam Carlisle, Sr. Director, Labor Relations,

On June 12-14, 2018 your negotiating committee met in Dallas, Texas, Southwest Airlines Headquarters to continue negotiations. Present for the company were: Adam Carlisle, Sr.

The Southwest Airlines Shop Steward Conference was held May 30 and 31, 2018 at the Winpisinger Center. President-Directing General Chair Dave Supplee made opening remarks

On Tuesday, May 15, 2018, your negotiating committee met in Dallas at Southwest Airlines Headquarters to begin contract negotiations. Present for the company were: Adam

Your Negotiating Committee for District 142, along with the General Chairs from District 142 and Grand Lodge representatives, participated in the Negotiation Preparation for Bargaining

We will be holding our Southwest Airlines Steward Conference May 30-31 (travel days May 29 and June 1). Deadline for registration is this Friday, May

Dear Sisters and Brothers: Just a reminder, the survey for negotiations closes this Saturday. If you haven’t participated in the survey yet, please do so

The House of Representatives Needs to Vote YES on the 2018 FAA Reauthorization Bill H.R. 4! The House of Representatives will be putting the FAA
